content:
• Thursday, August 9, 2012
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM) +3% AH after Bloomberg reports IBM has informally approached RIM about...

    Research In Motion (RIMM) +3% AH after Bloomberg reports IBM has informally approached RIM about acquiring its network operations centers (NOCs), which secure/compress content delivered to BlackBerries. Many have called on RIM to turn its NOCs into a standalone business that services multiple platforms. But former co-CEO Jim Balsillie was reportedly kicked out for wanting to do this. Bloomberg adds no one has shown interest in RIM's hardware ops, and no talks between RIM and IBM are currently under way.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 PM | 8 Comments
  • GNC

    GNC Holdings (NYSE:GNC) announces a 10M share secondary offering of its Class A common stock....

    GNC Holdings (NYSE:GNC) announces a 10M share secondary offering of its Class A common stock. The shares to be sold are by Ares Corporate Opportunities Fund II and Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan Board. The Company is neither issuing nor selling any shares in the offering. In addition, GNC says it's agreed to repurchase 6M shares of its Class A common stock directly from Ares immediately following the closing of the offering. Goldman is the sole underwriter. Shares +1.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:27 PM
  • JWN

    More on Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN): Q2 beats on a per share basis but comes up short on revenue. Total...

    More on Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN): Q2 beats on a per share basis but comes up short on revenue. Total sales increased by 7.4% Y/Y, but net profit fell due to a shift in the retailers anniversary sale - its largest sales event of the year - into the next quarter. The company also raised its FY12 EPS guidance to $3.40 to $3.50 and boosted its FY same-store sales growth outlook to between 6% and 7%, up from 4% to 6%. Shares +3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:56 PM
  • PEGA

    More on Pegasystems (NASDAQ:PEGA): Q2 misses on all fronts. Revenue growth was flat Y/Y, as...

    More on Pegasystems (NASDAQ:PEGA): Q2 misses on all fronts. Revenue growth was flat Y/Y, as economic uncertainty, especially in Europe, delayed many customers from executing new license agreements. Due to the delays, the company warns that FY12 revenue targets may be tough to hit. Shares -10.1% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:43 PM
  • WPM

    Silver Wheaton (SLW) declares $0.10/share quarterly dividend, 11.1% increase from prior dividend...

    Silver Wheaton (SLW) declares $0.10/share quarterly dividend, 11.1% increase from prior dividend of $0.09. Forward yield 1.31%. For shareholders of record Aug 30. Payable Sep 13. Ex-div date Aug 28. Shares +1.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE +22.6%) soared in late trading today to close at $0.613, a day after...

    A123 Systems (AONE +22.6%) soared in late trading today to close at $0.613, a day after announcing a financing deal with China's Wanxiang Group that one estimate valued at $0.55/share. The rally came even though Congressman Cliff Stearns (R-FL) expressed his opposition to the deal, due to concerns about the DOE-backed battery maker's IP being owned by a Chinese company.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:23 PM | 6 Comments
  • CPST

    Capstone Turbine (NASDAQ:CPST): FQ1 EPS loss of -$0.03 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $28.8M (+19%...

    Capstone Turbine (NASDAQ:CPST): FQ1 EPS loss of -$0.03 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $28.8M (+19% Y/Y) misses by $1.2M. Shares -7.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:19 PM
  • QCOM

    More on Spreadtrum's Q2: Q3 guidance is for revenue of $178M-$186M, compared with a $184.8M...

    More on Spreadtrum's Q2: Q3 guidance is for revenue of $178M-$186M, compared with a $184.8M consensus. That appears to be disappointing investors, and is overshadowing the Q2 beat. Also, Q2 sales of 3G baseband and RF chips fell 28% Q/Q (albeit while rising 23% Y/Y). Given how Chinese 3G phone sales are taking off, that could be sparking fears of share loss to MediaTek and/or QCOM. Sales of 2G/2.5G chips rose 32% Q/Q, but ASPs fell 9.5%. SPRD -10.6% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:13 PM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) says it is the subject of a U.S. antitrust investigation over...

    Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) says it is the subject of a U.S. antitrust investigation over possible violations in its purchase and lease of oil and gas rights. CHK reportedly plotted with Encana (NYSE:ECA) to suppress land prices in a promising oil and gas play in Michigan. Shares -1.4% AH. (10-Q)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:59 PM | 5 Comments
  • XTNT

    More on Bacterin International (BONE): Q2 beats on a per share basis while coming in-line with...

    More on Bacterin International (BONE): Q2 beats on a per share basis while coming in-line with revenue estimates. Total revenue grew by 9% Y/Y on higher wound care product sales, while fewer expenses and a jump in margins helped boost its bottom line. The company maintains its FY12 revenue guidance of $35M - $40M, in line, albeit at the lower end of Street estimates of $39.6M. Shares +7.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM
  • SMG

    More on Scotts Miracle-Gro (NYSE:SMG): FQ3 misses across the board as total revenues came in...

    More on Scotts Miracle-Gro (NYSE:SMG): FQ3 misses across the board as total revenues came in flat Y/Y. Net earnings declined 16% as higher costs pressured the company's core consumer products segment. The company blames a slow gardening season and waning consumer demand following a strong and early start to the lawn-care season for the miss. It raises its quarterly dividend by 8% however, to $0.325 a share from $0.30 per share. Shares -8.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 PM
  • CDXS

    Codexis (NASDAQ:CDXS): Q2 EPS of -$0.15 may not be comparable to consensus of -$0.18. Revenue of...

    Codexis (NASDAQ:CDXS): Q2 EPS of -$0.15 may not be comparable to consensus of -$0.18. Revenue of $22.9M (-12.1% Y/Y) misses by $7M. Shares -12.9% AH (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM
  • JOBS

    51job (NASDAQ:JOBS): Q2 EPS of $0.66 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $56.7M (+% Y/Y) beats by $1.2M....

    51job (NASDAQ:JOBS): Q2 EPS of $0.66 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $56.7M (+% Y/Y) beats by $1.2M. Shares +5.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM
  • DNKN

    Dunkin' Brands (NASDAQ:DNKN) -1.8% AH after announcing insiders will sell 21M shares (more than...

    Dunkin' Brands (NASDAQ:DNKN) -1.8% AH after announcing insiders will sell 21M shares (more than 1/6 of outstanding shares) through a secondary offering, and that the company will buy back another 15M shares from insiders. It looks as if the coffee chain's P-E investors are cashing out. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM | 4 Comments
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO) -4.4% AH after releasing its Q2 10-Q, which suggests new CEO Marissa Mayer is...

    Yahoo (YHOO) -4.4% AH after releasing its Q2 10-Q, which suggests new CEO Marissa Mayer is reviewing the company's capital allocation strategy. That could lead to the pulling of the $5.5B stock buyback program tied to Alibaba's $7.1B repurchase of half of Yahoo's 40% stake. Dan Loeb, who supported Mayer's hiring, can't be happy about this. The WSJ reported yesterday Mayer is looking to make acquisitions.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM | 5 Comments
  • MNST

    Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST) discloses it received in July a subpoena from a state attorney...

    Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST) discloses it received in July a subpoena from a state attorney general in connection with an investigation into the firm's marketing of its energy drinks. Shares -2.2% AH after a 9.7% fall in the regular session following earnings. (10-Q, pg. 49)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM
  • SAAS

    Incontact (NASDAQ:SAAS): Q2 EPS of -$0.04 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $26.2M (+20.7% Y/Y) misses...

    Incontact (NASDAQ:SAAS): Q2 EPS of -$0.04 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $26.2M (+20.7% Y/Y) misses by $0.3M. Shares +4.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM
  • UBNT

    More on Ubiquiti Networks' FQ4: Though EPS beat estimates, the wireless networking hardware...

    More on Ubiquiti Networks' FQ4: Though EPS beat estimates, the wireless networking hardware vendor is guiding for FQ1 revenue of $62M-$70M and EPS of $0.14-$0.17, well below a consensus of $98.4M and $0.29. Ubiquiti blames counterfeit goods, and the impact they've had on distributor inventories and customer buying patterns. A $100M stock buyback has been approved. UBNT -43.4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • OTEX

    Open Text (NASDAQ:OTEX): FQ4 EPS of $1.17 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $305.6M (+7% Y/Y) misses by...

    Open Text (NASDAQ:OTEX): FQ4 EPS of $1.17 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $305.6M (+7% Y/Y) misses by $3M. Shares -5.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • RICK

    Rick's Cabaret International (NASDAQ:RICK): Q2 EPS of $0.19 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $23.9M...

    Rick's Cabaret International (NASDAQ:RICK): Q2 EPS of $0.19 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $23.9M (+15% Y/Y) beats by $1.1M. Shares +5.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • UBNT

    Ubiquiti Networks (NASDAQ:UBNT): FQ4 EPS of $0.30 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $94.9M (+40.4% Y/Y)...

    Ubiquiti Networks (NASDAQ:UBNT): FQ4 EPS of $0.30 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $94.9M (+40.4% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -45% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • MIND

    Mitcham Industries (NASDAQ:MIND) says it's settled audit concerns with Canadian and U.S. tax...

    Mitcham Industries (NASDAQ:MIND) says it's settled audit concerns with Canadian and U.S. tax authorities over 2004 - 2006 tax returns from its Canadian subsidiary. It also releases its operational update on its equipment leasing operations for Q2, saying leasing revenue declined sequentially during the period due to normal seasonal factors. It now expects to earn approximately $10M - $11M, below the $12.3M reported during the prior year period. Shares -1.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • OCZ

    OCZ Technology (NASDAQ:OCZ) -4.8% AH after announcing CFO Arthur Knapp plans to retire. Knapp,...

    OCZ Technology (NASDAQ:OCZ) -4.8% AH after announcing CFO Arthur Knapp plans to retire. Knapp, 63, will stay on board until a successor is found. OCZ shares recently took off on Seagate buyout rumors, but fell back to earth after Seagate failed to announce a deal during its earnings report.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM | 4 Comments
  • ASYS

    Amtech Systems (NASDAQ:ASYS): Q2 EPS of -$0.31 beats by $0.21. Revenue of $24.3M (-66% Y/Y)...

    Amtech Systems (NASDAQ:ASYS): Q2 EPS of -$0.31 beats by $0.21. Revenue of $24.3M (-66% Y/Y) beats by $5M. Shares -10.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • NVDA

    Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA): FQ2 EPS of $0.19 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $1.04B (+2% Y/Y) beats by...

    Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA): FQ2 EPS of $0.19 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $1.04B (+2% Y/Y) beats by $30M. Expects FQ3 revenue of $1.15B-$1.25B, above $1.09B consensus. Shares +4.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • ARNA

    More on Arena Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARNA): Q2 EPS comes up short but beats top line estimates....

    More on Arena Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARNA): Q2 EPS comes up short but beats top line estimates. Total revenue jumped over 500% Y/Y, however the increase was primarily the result of the $20M milestone payment earned under its marketing and supply agreement with Japanese drug maker Eisai. Bottom line results were hit by higher losses from the revaluation of derivative liabilities. Shares -3.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 7 Comments
  • ATGE

    DeVry (DV): FQ4 EPS of $0.47 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $505M (-7.5% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +2.7%...

    DeVry (DV): FQ4 EPS of $0.47 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $505M (-7.5% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +2.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (NYSE:FIO) FQ4 EPS of $0.09 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $106.6M (+49% Y/Y) beats by...

    Fusion-io (NYSE:FIO) FQ4 EPS of $0.09 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $106.6M (+49% Y/Y) beats by $10.8M. Expects FQ1 revenue to "increase modestly" Q/Q, compared with consensus for a decline to $104.4M. Expects FY13 revenue growth of 45%-50%, above a consensus of 33%. Shares +20.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • BYI

    Bally Technologies (NYSE:BYI): Q2 EPS of $0.78 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $245.8M (+15% Y/Y)...

    Bally Technologies (NYSE:BYI): Q2 EPS of $0.78 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $245.8M (+15% Y/Y) beats by $2M. Shares +1.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • BRKS

    Brooks Automation (NASDAQ:BRKS): FQ3 EPS of $0.14 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $140.4M (-24.6%...

    Brooks Automation (NASDAQ:BRKS): FQ3 EPS of $0.14 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $140.4M (-24.6% Y/Y) misses by $3M. Shares -11% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • LGF.A

    Lions Gate Entertainment (LGF): FQ1 EPS of -$0.33 misses by $0.42. Revenue of $471.8M (+81% Y/Y)...

    Lions Gate Entertainment (LGF): FQ1 EPS of -$0.33 misses by $0.42. Revenue of $471.8M (+81% Y/Y) beats by $24M. Shares -3.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 5 Comments
  • HNSN

    Shares of Hansen Medical (HNSN -12.3%) take another leg down after its Q2 came up far short of...

    Shares of Hansen Medical (HNSN -12.3%) take another leg down after its Q2 came up far short of estimates late yesterday. Revenues fell 34.0% year over year to $3.5M, $2.8M below consensus, as its cost of revenues jumped to 26% due to lower system sales and R&D expenses nearly doubled.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM
  • ALJ

    Alon Energy (ALJ -9.2%) joins a growing trend among coastal refiners planning to use rail to...

    Alon Energy (ALJ -9.2%) joins a growing trend among coastal refiners planning to use rail to gain access to cheap inland crude. "We have tankage and land available to support the project and we have access to third-party pipelines," CEO Paul Eisman says. But investors, looking at weaker than expected Q2 numbers, send shares sliding.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • SNMP

    Constellation Energy Partners (CEP -3.9%) slides after posting a Q2 loss of $0.21/share as it...

    Constellation Energy Partners (CEP -3.9%) slides after posting a Q2 loss of $0.21/share as it cut back production with the price of oil and natural gas falling; CEP had posted a profit of $0.10/share in the year-ago period. Two-thirds of CEP's Q2 sales were from nat gas. FY2012 net production is forecast in a range of 13.3MMcfe-14.1MMcfe.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • CLR

    Continental Resources (CLR +3.7%) CEO Rick Bott says the driller will increase its 2012 capex...

    Continental Resources (CLR +3.7%) CEO Rick Bott says the driller will increase its 2012 capex budget to $3B, up from a revised $2.3B announced in May, due to higher costs and ramped up activity in the Bakken shale. CLR cut the number of Bakken rigs it operates to 19 from 26 in Q2; it has reduced the time it takes to drill a well by 30%, which enabled it to spud more wells with fewer rigs.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • AUY

    CEO Peter Marrone says Yamana Gold (AUY +2.6%) will be looking to continue its upward trend of...

    CEO Peter Marrone says Yamana Gold (AUY +2.6%) will be looking to continue its upward trend of gold and gold-equivalent production through acquisitions and a focus on projects in advanced development stages. He expects production startup at newly-acquired Cerro Morro in 2015 with a minimum of 200K oz. gold or gold equivalent annually. (Q2 earnings)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM
  • NUS

    Shares of Nu Skin (NUS +5.5%) are active today as Deutsche Bank's Bill Schmitz squares off on...

    Shares of Nu Skin (NUS +5.5%) are active today as Deutsche Bank's Bill Schmitz squares off on CNBC with Citron's Andrew Left over the recent allegations by Citron that NUS is violating direct selling laws in China. Left accuses the company of operating a multi-level marketing pyramid scheme, saying he knows "for a fact" that the company is in the wrong. Deutsche's Schmitz fires back, saying NUS "wrote the law" in China, and those distributors receiving commissions are also salaried. (Video)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM | 4 Comments
  • WPM

    "It's good to be back making acquisitions," Silver Wheaton's (SLW +2.1%) Randy Smallwood says...

    "It's good to be back making acquisitions," Silver Wheaton's (SLW +2.1%) Randy Smallwood says ahead of Q2 earnings and after its $750M deal to purchase gold and silver from HudBay mines. Deals had been too expensive with silver prices above $40/oz., but "we do think silver is near a bottom." As far as most analysts are concerned, the deal was worth the wait.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM | 2 Comments
  • MBI

    MBIA (MBI +16.2%) continues to add to gains following this morning's earnings call in which CEO...

    MBIA (MBI +16.2%) continues to add to gains following this morning's earnings call in which CEO Joe Brown vowed to fight BofA (NYSE:BAC) "all the way." Damages to MBIA from unpaid mortgage putbacks are nearly $5B, Brown contends.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM | 5 Comments
  • OSK

    Shares of Oshkosh (OSK +3.8%) shoot higher after Carl Icahn files a 13D with the SEC calling for...

    Shares of Oshkosh (OSK +3.8%) shoot higher after Carl Icahn files a 13D with the SEC calling for a spinoff of the company's JLG business.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • SCLN

    SciClone Pharmaceuticals (SCLN +16.8%) are soaring after its Q2 bottom line topped Street...

    SciClone Pharmaceuticals (SCLN +16.8%) are soaring after its Q2 bottom line topped Street estimates late yesterday. Total revenue jumped 22% Y/Y, helped by a 27% increase in sales of its drug Zadaxin, plus revenue growth from its primary care and oncology businesses in China and positive synergies from its recent takeover of NovaMed Pharmaceuticals.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • JRCCQ

    James River's (JRCC +15.3%) better-than-expected Q2 is pulling other coal names higher: Alpha...

    James River's (JRCC +15.3%) better-than-expected Q2 is pulling other coal names higher: Alpha Natural (ANR +16.3%) is bouncing after yesterday's earnings-induced loss; also ACI +12.1%, BTU +7.3%. But the reaction could be premature; a key to a potential coal rebound is China, and a recovery there isn't seen until H2, so coal may not see any big gains until early to mid 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 3 Comments
  • NOK

    Up initially after striking a patent-purchase deal with Nokia (NOK +4.5%), Vringo (VRNG -3.5%)...

    Up initially after striking a patent-purchase deal with Nokia (NOK +4.5%), Vringo (VRNG -3.5%) has sold off to $3.32. The fact Vringo will be financing the deal with a $31.2M stock offering featuring a sale price of $3.25/share is a likely reason why. Nokia, however, is holding onto most of its gains - investors probably care less about the deal per se than the fact it shows Nokia is serious about its stated plans to better monetize its IP. (NOK/RIMM lawsuit)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM | 4 Comments
  • SPWR

    Solar stocks are mostly higher after strong earnings but weak guidance from SunPower (SPWR...

    Solar stocks are mostly higher after strong earnings but weak guidance from SunPower (SPWR -11.3%): FSLR +2.3%, YGE +1%, STP +3.7%, TSL +2.7%. One bright spot for SPWR was a 10%-plus drop in blended cost/watt; it now expects to achieve a cost/watt of less than $0.75 on its lowest cost solar panels by year end, a full year ahead of schedule.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • CNX

    Consol Energy (CNX +7.6%) says its Bailey and Enlow Fork coal mines in Pennsylvania should be...

    Consol Energy (CNX +7.6%) says its Bailey and Enlow Fork coal mines in Pennsylvania should be back in operation by mid-August, operating at ~60% capacity. CNX had been forced to close the mines last month due to the collapse of two conveyor belts that carry coal from the underground mines to the processing plant.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • ABUS

    Tekmira Pharmaceuticals (TKMR +4.9%) gives an update on its leukemia drug Marqibo, saying that...

    Tekmira Pharmaceuticals (TKMR +4.9%) gives an update on its leukemia drug Marqibo, saying that its licensing partner, Talon Therapeutics, has received accelerated approval from the FDA for the treatment of adult patients with leukemia in second or greater relapse or whose disease has progressed following two or more anti-leukemia therapies.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • SGI

    After crashing post-earnings (I, II) two quarters in a row, Silicon Graphics (SGI +27.4%) is...

    After crashing post-earnings (I, II) two quarters in a row, Silicon Graphics (SGI +27.4%) is doing the opposite. Though FQ4 results were mixed, SGI is guiding for FQ1 revenue $180M-$195M and EPS of -$0.24 to -$0.16, above a consensus of $176.7M and -$0.27. That's enough to fuel a big rally in a heavily-shorted company with a low price/sales multiple. During its earnings call, SGI said it's seeing stronger demand for its servers for HPC and big data applications. FBN is upgrading to Outperform.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • SLXP

    Salix Pharmaceuticals (SLXP +2%) trades higher after beating bottom line Q2 estimates yesterday....

    Salix Pharmaceuticals (SLXP +2%) trades higher after beating bottom line Q2 estimates yesterday. Net profit rose 4.6% as the drug developer saw continued strength in sales of its Xifaxan tablets. The company also raised its FY12 outlook to $2.86 per share, up from its previous view of $2.59 a share, reflecting its March placement of $690M in senior notes.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM
  • ARUN

    In addition to pounding the table for Cisco, Goldman has made positive comments about top Wi-Fi...

    In addition to pounding the table for Cisco, Goldman has made positive comments about top Wi-Fi equipment rival Aruba Networks (ARUN +7.5%). A Goldman survey of networking resellers indicated Wi-Fi is a top growth category, and that customers are showing a greater willingness to buy from best-of-breed vendors such as Aruba. FQ4 results are due on Aug. 23.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • SGEN

    Seattle Genetics (SGEN +4%) gains despite posting a mixed second quarter. Total revenue surged...

    Seattle Genetics (SGEN +4%) gains despite posting a mixed second quarter. Total revenue surged on narrower losses and higher sales of its lymphoma drug Adcetris, but revenue growth still fell short of analyst expectations, largely due to lofty expectations by the Street on Adcetris sales numbers.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM | 2 Comments
  • DMND

    Shares of Diamond Foods (DMND +7.5%) shoot higher on unconfirmed rumors that a large investor...

    Shares of Diamond Foods (DMND +7.5%) shoot higher on unconfirmed rumors that a large investor has taken a new position. (Earlier: Fisher Asset Management's late July buy helps solidify DMND)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM | 4 Comments
  • KGC

    Kinross Gold (KGC +1.4%) shares bounce off early losses stemming from Q2 results, as investors...

    Kinross Gold (KGC +1.4%) shares bounce off early losses stemming from Q2 results, as investors like the sound of a three-pronged strategy to get the struggling miner back on track. “This value-driven approach may lead us to make tough choices,” new CEO Paul Rollinson says, referring to a potential downsizing of its costly Tasiast project in Mauritania.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • INFI

    Infinity Pharmaceuticals (INFI +2.2%) sluffs off pressure from pricing its 5.3M share offering...

    Infinity Pharmaceuticals (INFI +2.2%) sluffs off pressure from pricing its 5.3M share offering earlier this morning to trade higher. Shares priced at $14.50, a 4.4% discount to Wednesday's close. The stock has been a resilient performer, surging over 84% in the past 12 months.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • WIFI

    Boingo (WIFI -23.2%) crashes after missing Q2 estimates and guiding for 2012 revenue of...

    Boingo (WIFI -23.2%) crashes after missing Q2 estimates and guiding for 2012 revenue of $108M-$111M and EPS of $0.22-$0.27, below a consensus of $111.2M and $0.29. Deutsche is downgrading Boingo, arguing visibility is limited and the lowered guidance may still be difficult to achieve. The spread of ad-supported Wi-Fi hotspots could be affecting Boingo; ahead of the report, the company announced it's buying Cloud Nine Media, a provider of ad-supported Wi-Fi, to address this market.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM | 1 Comment
  • FLT

    FleetCor Technologies (FLT +9%), a provider of fuel cards and workforce payment products, pops...

    FleetCor Technologies (FLT +9%), a provider of fuel cards and workforce payment products, pops after beating Q2 estimates and raising its view for the year. Total revenue jumped 28% Y/Y, as its top line benefited from a recent push into Brazil and Russia.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • NOV

    National Oilwell Varco's (NOV +0.7%) $2.5B deal to purchase Robbins & Myers (RBN...

    National Oilwell Varco's (NOV +0.7%) $2.5B deal to purchase Robbins &Myers (RBN +27.3%) is the sixth deal NOV has made this year alone, pushing its total M&A spending past $4B.     Windstream (WIN -8%) sells off following its Q2 miss. Consumer service revenue fell 3% Y/Y thanks to access line losses and just 4% growth in broadband (Windstream's DSL ops face tough competition from cable). Business sales rose 2%, while wholsesale, an area Windstream is reducing exposure to, fell 12%. Adjusted free cash flow was $135M, above net income of $54M, but the 1H dividend payout ratio stood at a sky-high 60%. Nomura downgraded Windstream yesterday. (PR)
